plot: The Legend of Zelda: The Complexity of Mechanics
summary: They analyze some of the many game mechanics available to Link in the classic Legend of Zelda series of video games. In each case, they prove that the generalized game with that mechanic is polynomial, NP-complete or NP-hard. In the process they give an overview of many of the hardness proof techniques developed for video games over the past decade: the motion-planning-through-gadgets framework, the planar doors framework, and the collectible tokens and toll roads / Hamiltonicity framework.
